intro: Englerina ramulosa, commonly known as the slender-stemmed englerina, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many economically important species. The plant is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and small, opposite leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, with four or five petals, and are clustered in inflorescences. Englerina ramulosa is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests or along stream banks.
